title: Introduction to animovement
text: get started, first install package. Next, put together tutorial takes necessary steps, reading data summarising movements. recommend going steps specified order recommended workflow. Read trackball data Clean tracks Compute kinematics Compute movement statistics

title: Calculate kinematics
text: work movement data, often interested just animal ; ’re interested fast moves, heading etc. calculate_kinematics calculates range kinematic variables: distance: distance animal moved since last observation (simply calculated using Pythagoras’ theorem) v_translation: translational velocity, like see speedometer car. direction: direction (radians) animal heading - arrow compass heading. rotation: Difference direction last observation. v_rotation: rotational velocity (rad/s).
code: # Augment all data in list df_kinematics <- df_smooth |>    calculate_kinematics() glimpse(df_kinematics) #> Rows: 37,039 #> Columns: 12 #> $ uid           <chr> "2UL50GHAQRV61BE7E2DZ", "2UL50GHAQRV61BE7E2DZ", "2UL50GH… #> $ time          <dbl> 0.00000000, 0.01666667, 0.03333333, 0.05000000, 0.066666… #> $ keypoint      <chr> "centroid", "centroid", "centroid", "centroid", "centroi… #> $ x             <dbl> NA, NA, NA, 0.002538071, 0.012690355, 0.025380711, 0.038… #> $ y             <dbl> NA, NA, NA, 0.005076142, 0.022842640, 0.060913706, 0.109… #> $ distance      <dbl> NA, NA, NA, NA, 0.02046258, 0.04013043, 0.04986518, 0.05… #> $ v_translation <dbl> NA, NA, NA, NA, 1.2277550, 2.4078256, 2.9919111, 3.03424… #> $ a_translation <dbl> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, 7.080424e+01, 3.504513e+01, 2.539884… #> $ direction     <circular> NA, NA, NA, NA, 1.0516502, 1.2490458, 1.3134726, 1.… #> $ rotation      <circular> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, 1.973956e-01, 6.442684e-02, -4.… #> $ v_rotation    <circular> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, -1.184373e+01, -3.865610e+00, 2… #> $ a_rotation    <circular> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, 478.6874, 406.7352, -174.79…

title: Calculate kinematics
text: Alternatively, can perform data cleaning methods. Whatever way choose , make sure just calculate summaries without knowing ’s . Kinematics much prone small values change. assess two ways:
code: df_kinematics_clean <- df_kinematics |>    clean_kinematics() df_kinematics_alternative <- df_kinematics |>    filter(v_translation > 0.25 & v_rotation < 200) library(patchwork) a <- df_kinematics_clean |>    ggplot(aes(x, y, colour = time)) +   geom_path() +   scale_colour_viridis_c() b <- df_kinematics_clean |>    ggplot(aes(time, direction)) +   geom_line() c <- df_kinematics_clean |>    ggplot(aes(time, v_translation)) +   geom_line() d <- df_kinematics_clean |>    # filter(time < 20) |>    # filter(v_translation > 0) |>    ggplot(aes(time, v_rotation)) +   geom_line() e <- df_kinematics_clean |>    ggplot(aes(abs(v_translation))) +   geom_histogram() f <- df_kinematics_clean |>    ggplot(aes(abs(v_rotation))) +   geom_histogram() (a + b) / (c + d) / (e + f) #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_line()`). #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. #> Warning: Removed 66 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range #> (`stat_bin()`). library(performance) df_kinematics_clean |>    na.omit() |>    select(rotation) |>   performance::check_outliers() #> 90 outliers detected: cases 37, 327, 332, 380, 383, 388, 473, 474, 475, #>   523, 764, 807, 907, 1306, 1350, 1364, 1479, 1777, 1802, 1838, 1855, #>   1888, 1982, 1985, 1987, 2003, 2125, 2126, 2276, 2415, 2486, 2890, 3319, #>   3380, 3396, 3513, 3569, 3590, 3687, 4080, 4099, 4104, 4236, 4284, 4318, #>   4369, 4481, 4482, 4529, 4637, 4724, 4725, 4765, 4767, 4810, 4840, 4856, #>   4891, 4892, 4893, 4906, 4972, 5019, 5102, 5103, 5146, 5272, 5298, 5317, #>   5318, 5335, 5337, 5370, 5374, 5376, 5384, 5398, 5406, 5519, 5523, 5531, #>   5533, 5534, 5538, 5543, 5564, 5575, 5598, 5609, 5642. #> - Based on the following method and threshold: mahalanobis (10.828). #> - For variable: rotation. pl_direction <- df_kinematics_clean |>    # filter(time < 20) |>    ggplot(aes(x = direction, y = v_translation)) +    stat_density_2d(     geom = "tile",      aes(fill = after_stat(density)),     n=c(40, 10),      contour = F   ) +    scale_fill_viridis_c() +   # scale_fill_gradientn(colours=rev(rainbow(32)[1:23])) +    coord_polar(direction = -1,               start = -pi/2               ) +   # scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0,2*pi)) +   theme_minimal()  max_coord <- max(abs(c(df_kinematics_clean$x, df_kinematics_clean$y)), na.rm = TRUE) pl_path <- df_kinematics_clean |>    ggplot(aes(x, y, colour = v_translation)) +   geom_path() +   coord_fixed() +   scale_x_continuous(limits = c(-max_coord, max_coord)) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(-max_coord, max_coord)) +   scale_colour_viridis_c() +   theme_minimal()  pl_path + pl_direction +   plot_layout(guides = "collect")

title: Clean tracks
text: confident sensors give correct readings, can skip step.. Even typical trackball setup optical flow sensors (e.g. computer mice), chance get spurious readings sensors. aim step root readings. ’ll use data read Read data article, ’ve missed step need revisit read data. Let us first visualise dx dy values.  animals spend significant amount time sitting still (case ). ensure zero-readings skew outlier detection, let’s filter another look histograms.  Now can see might observations extreme observations. now researcher decide whether attempt filtering outliers, whether happy . may want filter 0 readings first sight, looks fine. stop say ’re confident spurious outliers. also apply variety automated outlier detection techniques. several ways achieving , luckily performance package got us covered check_outliers() function. Since methods rely histograms/probability density functions,
code: library(ggplot2) df <- df |>    mutate(displacement = sqrt(dx^2 + dy^2)) full_trace <- df |>    ggplot(aes(time, displacement)) +   geom_line() +   xlab("Time (s)") +   ylab("dx, dy (dots)")  partial_trace <- df |>    filter(time < 20) |>    ggplot(aes(time, displacement)) +   geom_line() +   xlab("Time (s)") +   ylab("dx, dy (dots)")  hist_dist <- df |>    ggplot(aes(displacement)) +   geom_histogram()  library(patchwork) full_trace / partial_trace / hist_dist #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. hist_dist2 <- df |>    filter(displacement != 0) |>    ggplot(aes(displacement)) +   geom_histogram()  hist_dist2 #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. library(performance) df |>    mutate(ax = dx - lag(dx),          ay = dy - lag(dy)) |>   na.omit() |>    filter(time < 200) |>    filter(dx != 0) |>    select(ax, ay) |>    check_outliers() |>    plot()

title: Clean tracks
text: case removed outliers, can now interpolate across gaps created. CONTINUED…

title: Clean tracks
text: left smooth tracks, done using smooth_tracks() function. smoothing super simple. smooth_tracks() provides different options: roll_mean roll_median SOON savitsky_golay rolling filters can provide window_width, .e. many observations use rolling filter. filters result NA values beginning end data. important point smooth_tracks() , instead using x y values, first back-transforms raw values obtained sensors (effectively “differences” coordinates, dx dy) performs smoothing , finally converting back x y. may seem strange previously worked tracking data computer vision GPS loggers. However, whereas modalities return “true” coordinates outlier, mouse sensors . way can identify rogue values filtering raw values. Let’s try smoothing data rolling_mean filter 0.5 second (30 observations sampling rate 60Hz) window width. case work multiple keypoints /individuals can use group_by metadata tidyverse-friendly workflow. Let’s visualise compare. Note although difference may seem negligible plotting paths, may become important computing derivatives velocity acceleration.  different sensors good job! can see smoothed track end bit left raw version.
code: df_smooth <- df |>    smooth_track(method = "rolling_median", window_width = 5) library(ggplot2) ggplot() +   geom_path(data = df, aes(x,y), colour = "red") +   geom_path(data = df_smooth, aes(x,y), colour = "blue") #> Warning: Removed 5 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_path()`).

title: Mission & Scope
text: primary goal animovement package offer streamlined standardised workflow analysing animal movement data, syntax designed integrate seamlessly tidyverse ecosystem. Animal movement, whether produced humans animals, crucial navigating interacting environment. Understanding movements great interest scientists diverse fields ethology, behavioral ecology, biomechanics, neuroscience. numerous tools available quantifying movement, data produce — whether video tracking software hardware like treadmills, trackballs, accelerometers — often lack standardised approach analysis. makes difficult easily process compare movement data across different studies platforms. animovement package addresses gap establishing standardised workflow processing movement data, leveraging common data formats (collaboration movement) offering “recipe” streamlined data analysis.

title: Mission & Scope
text: core, animovement processes trajectories individual keypoints time. spatial position individual represented one (centroid) keypoints (pose), provided 1D (x), 2D (x, y), 3D (x, y, z) coordinates. sequentially collected positions form tracks time. neuroscience ethology, tracks commonly generated : Pose estimation tools like DeepLabCut SLEAP, track multiple keypoints individual. Centroid tracking software like TRex idtracker.ai, focuses single point (centroid) per individual. Treadmills trackballs, record movement belt ball, serving proxies 1D (treadmill) 2D (trackball) centroid tracking. vision provide intuitive accessible workflow using familiar tidyverse syntax. animovement designed handle data various sources, supporting 1D, 2D, 3D tracking single multiple individuals. practice, goal make possible derive meaningful insights movement data fewer 10 lines code. example:
code: library(animovement) movement_summary <- read_deeplabcut(path) |>    clean_tracks() |>    calculate_kinematics() |>    clean_kinematics() |>    calculate_statistics()

title: Read trackball data
text: recommend keeping analysis scripts data project (doesn’t mean folder), use great package package manage files (see documentation learn ). First, ’ll let R know project root folder. data lives funky place (constraints R package), giving file paths easy. Great, now file paths. function needs know things. Takes either "free" "fixed". column contains time stamps either seconds datetime format (takes either column number name quotes, e.g. 4 "time") can actual sampling rate, use information bin observations, can easily choose lower sampling rate. value optional, provided used convert spatial estimates unit-less centimeters. Can found computer mice. Let’s try read provided files:
code: library(here, quietly = TRUE) #> here() starts at /home/runner/work/animovement/animovement here::i_am("vignettes/articles/read-trackball.Rmd") #> here() starts at /home/runner/work/animovement/animovement filepath_1 <- here("tests", "data", "single", "opticalflow_sensor_1.csv") filepath_2 <- here("tests", "data", "single", "opticalflow_sensor_2.csv") filepaths <- c(filepath_1, filepath_2)  # These might be something like: here("data", "trackball", "sensor_1", "trackballdata_100.csv") for you! df <- read_trackball(   filepaths,    setup = "of_free",   col_time = 4,   sampling_rate = 60,   distance_scale = 394   )

title: Read trackball data
text: working multiple experimental trials, multiple ways reading data whilst keeping track important information. ’ll cover ways supported animovement. use: File names contain little information. use: File names contain enough information can used distinguish experiments.

title: Read trackball data
text: use: File names contain little information. scenario use spreadsheet keep track files go together. .xlsx file contains correct pairs file names. Let’s begin reading inspecting file. can import data, one experiment . , use package make file management easier.
code: library(readxl) metadata_path <- here("inst", "extdata", "multi", "trackball_filenames.xlsx") metadata_file <- read_xlsx(metadata_path) metadata_file #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   identity date                filename_a                      filename_b        #>   <chr>    <dttm>              <chr>                           <chr>             #> 1 A100     2021-08-05 00:00:00 GB_COM6_2021-08-05T15_37_55.csv GB_COM7_2021-08-… #> 2 A100     2021-08-12 00:00:00 GB_COM6_2021-08-12T15_37_55.csv GB_COM7_2021-08-… library(tibble) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  # First, we'll create an empty data frame which we'll read our data into df <- tibble()  # Then we loop through the rows in the metadata file for (i in 1:nrow(metadata_file)){      # Like before, change the path to match your local file structure   file_primary <- here("inst", "extdata", "multi", metadata_file$filename_a[i])   file_secondary <- here("inst", "extdata", "multi", metadata_file$filename_b[i])      # Then we'll read all the file   df_temp <- read_trackball(     c(file_primary, file_secondary),      setup = "of_free",     col_time = 4,     sampling_rate = 60,     distance_scale = 394     )      # And we can add other metadata, such as the identity and date to distinguish between experiments   df_temp <- df_temp |>      mutate(       id = metadata_file$identity[i],        date = metadata_file$date[i])      # Finally, we bind the data together   df <- bind_rows(df, df_temp) }

title: Read trackball data — read_trackball
text: paths Two file paths, one sensor (although one allowed fixed setup, of_fixed). setup type experimental setup used. Expects either of_free, of_fixed fictrac (soon). sampling_rate Sampling rate tells function long time integrate . sampling rate 60(Hz) mean windows 1/60 sec used integrate . col_time column contains information time. Can specified either column number (numeric) name column one (character). either datetime (POSIXt) seconds (numeric). col_dx Column name x-axis values col_dy Column name y-axis values ball_calibration running of_fixed experiment, may (necessary) provide calibration factor. factor number recorded 360 degree spin. can use calibrate_trackball function get number. Alternatively, provide ball_diameter distance_scale (e.g. mouse dpcm). ball_diameter running of_fixed experiment, ball diameter needed together either ball_calibration distance_scale. distance_scale using computer mice, might getting unit-less data . However, computer mice factor called "dots-per-cm", can use convert estimates centimeters. distance_unit unit used. distance_scale also used, unit scaled data. E.g. trackball data optical flow sensors, can use mouse dots-per-cm (dpcm) 394 setting distance_unit = "cm" distance_scale = 394. verbose FALSE (default), suppress warning messages.

title: Validate file — validate_files
code: validate_files(   path,   expected_permission = "r",   expected_suffix = NULL,   expected_headers = c("x", "y", "time") )

title: Validate file — validate_files
text: path Path(s) file. expected_permission Expected access permission(s) file. "r", file expected readable. "w", file expected writable. "rw", file expected readable writable. Default: "r". expected_suffix Expected suffix(es) file. NULL (default), check skipped. expected_headers Expected column name(s) present among header names. Default c("x", "y", "time").

title: animovement 0.2.0
text: Package name changed animovement! reflect change scope package now cover wide variety movement data, package changed name. conscious decision maintaining two packages similar functionality wouldn’t feasible long-term. new update brings wealth new functionality, also lot breaking changes. update, package aligns much closer vision , expect major breaking changes near future. let’s delve new stuff! Much improved documentation Added new readers read_deeplabcut(), read_sleap(), read_trex()… Standardised data cleaning smooth_tracks()  tests Although annoying current users, necessity ensure proper testing various functions now broken smaller subsets. still need former trackballr package functionality, can download source files Github install source. encounter bugs, please report Github issues.
